title: Placement stats updated one
content:
Source:jawahar himself‚ò†Ô∏è
Jawahar also said these are the best placement stats in banglore at the moment.



P.S : i hope i dont have to take down this post later‚ò†Ô∏è

comments.body: Number of students with gpa above 7.75 sounds too less.
Fr! Thought the same
I've seen 900+ students in the DAC scholarship list.
It's only for a specific campus ig
Makes sense
How can the median be more than the avg?

No, it is a common misconception that median is always < mean. It is statistically possible! If the values after the median show a lesser increase than the decrease of values before median, then the distribution gets skewed 

For example, for set: {1, 2, 2, 4, 8, 8, 9, 10, 10} , median = 8 but average = 6.

Translating to placement terms, this means that companies after offering greater than 12 aren't much higher than 12 (maybe 13-15). On the other hand, companies offering lesser than 12 are also offering significantly lower than 12 (2-5), bringing down the average.

No I am not fun at parties.
In short, offers above 12lpa aren't significantly more than 12lpa and cluttered around a small range , offers below 12lpa are drastically lower and also probably cluttered towards very low values
Yes. Looks like placements are suffering quite a bit this time. Job market is really bad right now.
But isn't placement centralised?
The actual number of ppl above 7.75 is double that. Does this only include RR campus or both campuses?
"pride of PESU"
Alr thanks
Is this only for the CSE branch?
So 459+596 are total placed?
The gpa above 7.75 is not no of students who got above 7.75 , its the no of ppl with t1 jobs and who have got more than 7.75
I dont think u can take all internships as ppl being placed , not all companies give ppo, some only have internships
But only 350 have got T1 jobs ...how is number of ppl with gpa > 7.75 more than no of ppl who have T1 jobs?(425)
There is overlap also between ppl placed and ppl who got internship ig cause most ppl get internship+fte offers...
Yeah but they're out of placement drive if it's performance based conversion?
Nerd
2024 batch ??

From RVCE
It's similar here .The cse department shows about 21lpa average 66% students are placed rn placements are on going 63lpa highest till date.
